articles.title: Top NHL Players
articles.intro: For one week, we put aside the development of Lygue version 3 to build Top NHL Players. This side project is a collection of top NHL players grouped by position and year.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Welcome to Maxime
articles.intro: I'm proud to announce that Maxime Beaudoin is joining me to build a better Lygue.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Statistics columns
articles.intro: You can now decide what statistics are shown (hockey and baseball).
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Supporting men’s health...
articles.intro: Once again this year, we let our mustaches grow in support to Movember. Help us fight cancer!
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Version 2 private beta
articles.intro: Since saturday, private beta for version 2 is open. It should be open for about 2 weeks. Then, it will lygue.com will be open to everyone.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Back @ work!
articles.intro: For a few weeks, we put Lygue aside to develop Playffs. But now that round 2 is about to begin, we can get back to work.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Let the mustaches grow!
articles.intro: We are happy to be part of Movember this year. Support Movember and our team by donating to Lygue.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Multi-season support is available...
articles.intro: This is a major update tonight. We just added multi-season support. So if you already own a league, you will not lose past season statistics.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Ligues.ca becoming Lygue... soon.
articles.intro: Soon, Ligues.ca will become Lygue. We have decided to change our name to something easy to remember, available under dotcom and easy to say in any languages.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Hello summer
articles.intro: A few weeks ago, we released baseball and most recently, basketball and volleyball. But summer also rhymes with soccer and football. So here they are... You are now able to create soccer and football leagues.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Baseball is now available
articles.intro: As you know, we are working on baseball leagues since a while. So, today is the big day. We release baseball leagues and some minor updates.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Hockey playoff & Baseball news
articles.intro: Playoff are probably coming soon in your league. Tomorrow, we’ve added “Playoff” filter in section Schedule. So, now, you are able to enter your playoff schedule.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Custom penalties
articles.intro: Some of you asked for the possibility to add custom penalties to your leagues. It’s available tonight...
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Penalties
articles.intro: This weekend, we’ll add a new tab called “Penalties” in the player profile. It will contain a complete list of all the player’s penalties. This new feature will allow you to better keep track of the player.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Leaders...
articles.intro: Today, we added Leaders in Players section. Basically, this sub-section shows top 3 players for goals, assists, points, goalies’ wins, goalies’ gaa and goalies’ shutouts. Players (forwards and defenses) and goalies are now two distinct sub-section.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Work hard !
articles.intro: We still work hard at Ligues.ca. We are currently working on few things that will be release soon.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Homepage, filter by city & discussions
articles.intro: We are still working on the homepage because we are not satisfied by the current one. Our goal is to do a page that will show the three main sections: Leagues, Places and Players.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Release done! (And what we are working on)
articles.intro: As you may have probably noticed, a major release has been done 3 days ago. We are very happy of this release. We think the site is cleaner and simplier.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Widgetify!
articles.intro: Everybody who own a website will be able to show teams’ standing nor top players list on it by including a simple Javascript widget. Both widgets are configurable. You will be able to change limit of teams to show (or players) and activate or not default CSS stylesheet.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: A bit more social...
articles.intro: Today, we have release version 0.5. This version makes Ligues.ca a bit more social because we added Facebook Connect and a tool to share stuff with your friends on del.icio.us, Facebook and Twitter.
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: We are online
articles.intro: We are happy to be online after several months of development. We are still in beta for few months...
articles.author: dominic

articles.title: Countdown to private beta
articles.intro: Our goal is to go in private beta with some friends on mid-august. We got less than 30 tasks to resolved before...
articles.author: dominic
